support_summary: ATXN3 interacts with STUB1/CHIP and is recruited to monoubiquitinated STUB1/CHIP to restrict the length of ubiquitin chains on its substrates.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 collaborates with the E3 ubiquitin ligase STUB1 (also known as CHIP) in protein quality control. Monoubiquitination of STUB1/CHIP by the E2 enzyme Ube2w facilitates the recruitment of ATXN3. ATXN3 then modulates the ubiquitination of STUB1/CHIP's misfolded substrates.
functions.effect_description: Instead of completely removing ubiquitin chains, ATXN3 acts as an editor, trimming long polyubiquitin chains on STUB1/CHIP substrates. This prevents their immediate degradation by the proteasome, allowing more time for chaperone-mediated refolding. After the substrate is properly ubiquitinated, ATXN3 can then deubiquitinate STUB1/CHIP itself, terminating the reaction.
biological_consequence: A misfolded protein is bound by chaperones and STUB1/CHIP → STUB1/CHIP is monoubiquitinated by Ube2w → ATXN3 is recruited to the complex → A second E2 enzyme extends the ubiquitin chain on the substrate → ATXN3 trims the ubiquitin chain, limiting its length → Proteasomal degradation is delayed, allowing for refolding attempts → ATXN3 deubiquitinates STUB1/CHIP to terminate the cycle.
specific_effects: Restricts the length of ubiquitin chains on STUB1/CHIP substrates.
Prevents further extension of ubiquitin chains on substrates.
Deubiquitinates STUB1/CHIP after substrate ubiquitination is complete.

evidence.paper_title: Ube2w and ataxin-3 coordinately regulate the ubiquitin ligase CHIP
evidence.relevant_quote: Monoubiquitination of CHIP by Ube2w stabilizes the interaction between CHIP and ataxin-3, which through its DUB activity limits the length of chains attached to CHIP substrates. Upon completion of substrate ubiquitination ataxin-3 deubiquitinates CHIP, effectively terminating the reaction.

evidence.paper_title: The deubiquitinase function of ataxin-3 and its role in the pathogenesis of Machado-Joseph disease and other diseases
evidence.relevant_quote: Monoubiquitination of CHIP by Ube2w, an initiator E2, promotes recruitment of ataxin-3 to the CHIP ubiquitination complex before ubiquitin chains are assembled on substrates of CHIP. Contrary to other E3/DUB pairs where the DUB completely deubiquitinates its E3 or a substrate, ataxin-3 instead appears to control ubiquitin chain length on CHIP substrates and deubiquitinates CHIP once polyubiquitinated substrates have assembled.

mechanism: ATXN3 collaborates with the E3 ubiquitin ligase STUB1 (also known as CHIP) in protein quality control. Monoubiquitination of STUB1/CHIP by the E2 enzyme Ube2w facilitates the recruitment of ATXN3. ATXN3 then modulates the ubiquitination of STUB1/CHIP's misfolded substrates.
effect: Instead of completely removing ubiquitin chains, ATXN3 acts as an editor, trimming long polyubiquitin chains on STUB1/CHIP substrates. This prevents their immediate degradation by the proteasome, allowing more time for chaperone-mediated refolding. After the substrate is properly ubiquitinated, ATXN3 can then deubiquitinate STUB1/CHIP itself, terminating the reaction.
summary: ATXN3 interacts with STUB1 to modulate substrate ubiquitination, ultimately affecting atxn3 deubiquitinates stub1/chip to terminate the cycle.

evidence.paper_title: Ube2w and ataxin-3 coordinately regulate the ubiquitin ligase CHIP
evidence.relevant_quote: Monoubiquitination of CHIP by Ube2w stabilizes the interaction between CHIP and ataxin-3, which through its DUB activity limits the length of chains attached to CHIP substrates. Upon completion of substrate ubiquitination ataxin-3 deubiquitinates CHIP, effectively terminating the reaction.

evidence.relevant_quote: Monoubiquitination of CHIP by Ube2w, an initiator E2, promotes recruitment of ataxin-3 to the CHIP ubiquitination complex before ubiquitin chains are assembled on substrates of CHIP. Contrary to other E3/DUB pairs where the DUB completely deubiquitinates its E3 or a substrate, ataxin-3 instead appears to control ubiquitin chain length on CHIP substrates and deubiquitinates CHIP once polyubiquitinated substrates have assembled.
